page.title: 18PEAT-FUEL FOR BURNING 2/2
page.content: After the heaps of peat have dried enough,this may take 3-5 weeks depending on the weather,then the peat is ready to take home.Most people bag the peat up before loading it onto trailers pulled by tractors.Some load loose peats straight into the trailer. Once back home the peats are stored either in a stack,built carefully so that rain runs off and does not soak into the stack or it may be tipped out into a shed or store known as a 'peattie hoose'. The best peat ,which is like soft butter and a light brown colour when cast,turns black and very hard when dry. Peat with fibre through it will burn also when dry but will not give out so much heat. Fibre and roots in peat is locally called 'horse-flesh' and is much more difficult to cast! Hands may blister casting this type!
